content:
Some students have been asking where to find the "Getting Started" handout for installing Python. You'll find it within the zip file that's downloaded when you click the "Download Files" link at the top of Problem Set 0's page.

https://sicp-s1.mit.edu/fall22/psets/1_pset0

The handout walks you through installing the Anaconda distribution of Python, and also updating and testing that it works. It's important to update the software (namely, Spyder) to fix a bug relating to Python's input() function.

EDIT: Students with M1 Macs are reporting difficulties installing Anaconda and Spyder. Our TAs and LAs in office hours are working on an alternate options for installation. Pset 0 isn't graded, so if you are having installation trouble, don't stress about submitting Pset 0 by tomorrow.

EDIT 2: Our TAs have put together two new documents on alternatives to installing Anaconda. Pset 0's zip file has been updated to include them. You can either install Spyder standalone, which includes the Python packages we'll use, or install VSCode and then its Python extension along with the necessary packages.

If you are still having trouble installing, please seek help in office hours ASAP.
subject: Installing Anaconda / Python
